fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42544].
  {panel}

I've opened a Jira that had collapsed comments, and manually uncollapsed the comments. Then I press the arrow to switch the comment ordering.

Actual result:
Comments are recollapsed, same as they were when I opened the Jira.

Expected result:
Manual uncollapsing is preserved.

I'd expect collapsing to be reapplied (aka manual uncollapsing is forgotten) when the issue is opened for the first time in a browser tab. So having it open in one tab, then opening in a new tab, the new tab gets collapsing. Reloading the original tab preserves its manual uncollapsing.
fields.summary: Changing the comment ordering re-applies the collapsing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42543].
  {panel}

Sometimes I get assigned a Jira that's already had a lot of activity. I've never opened it before. I open it for the first time for me.

Actual result:
Some comments are collapsed.

Expected result:
Only comments that I have seen before are collapsed.

Generally, I like the comment collapsing, it's a nice feature. I think the behaviour could greatly improved though, the above actual/expected result is just once specific instance of not-quite-working-the-way-I-expect.

Here's my vision, these are all per-user settings \[default value]:

'How many comments collapse?': All, None, X, Show X and collapse remaining \[Show 3]
'Always show unseen comments': checked/unchecked \[checked]
  +-> 'Unseen comments do/don't count for collapsing': Do, Don't \[Don't if 'Always Show' is checked, disabled if unchecked]

Comments that haven't been seen have a visual marker to indicate that they are unseen.

Example 1:

The user has chosen:
'How many comments collapse?': Show 5 and collapse remaining
'Always show unseen comments': checked
'Unseen comments do/don't count for collapsing': Don't

An issue that has not been opened before: All comments would be shown, they are all unseen.

An issue that has been opened, and has had no new comments added since: the most recent comments are shown, up to 5 of them, and any remaining are collapsed.

An issue that has been opened, and has new comments: The unseen comments are shown, plus up to 5 of the most recent seen comments are shown, and the remainder are collapsed.

Example 2:

The user has chosen:
'How many comments collapse?': Show 3 and collapse remaining
'Always show unseen comments': unchecked
'Unseen comments do/don't count for collapsing': \[disabled]

An issue that has not been opened before: Show up to 3 comments, collapse remaining

An issue that has been opened, and has had no new comments added since: Show up to 3 comments, collapse remaining

An issue that has been opened, and has new comments: Show up to 3 comments, collapse remaining
fields.summary: Comments collapsed without having been seen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42542].
  {panel}

Ordering of comments on issues can be ascending or descending. I like the order that is opposite of what my IT dept has set as the server-wide default. I change it, but then later it reverts back to the default.

Actual result:
My preferred ordering for comments is not remembered forever.

Expected result:
My preferred ordering is remembered forever.

What I think the problem is:
Ordering of comments is stored per-session, but should be stored per-user instead.

I believe this is possible because other settings** are stored per-user and persist across sessions.
**An example is Details View vs List View for search results. I didn't like the default so chose the other setting, and my selection persists forever. Therefore it is a per-user setting, not a per-session setting.
fields.summary: Comment ordering setting stored per-session

fields.description:
h5. Summary:
Importing issues from CSV via Issue dropdown menu fails to create values in custom field the way it works when user uses "External CSV import" via Administrator Page.

*Affects JIRA*: 6.3.X

h5. How to replicate:
# Create a CSV with a few sample data(you can use the sample attached).
# Create the custom fields that were listed in the CSV in your JIRA instance. Do not enter any data especially in 'Select List field', 'Radio Button' (should not contain same data as one that is in CSV) and all other fields that require user to add their options on creation.
# In the CSV add a user that is the reporter but does not exist in JIRA.
# Import the CSV via the Issue Drop down menu by selecting: " Import Issues from CSV"
# Associate the fields with their respective equivalents from the CSV(Don't select any match data).
# Select Begin Import and you should get an error similar the the one below:
!CSV Import Error.PNG|thumbnail!

If however you use the external CSV import, the issue would not occur because the fields will be created.
fields.summary: Importing issues From CSV via Issue dropdown menu fails to create values in custom field the way it works when user uses External CSV import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42531].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Install fresh JIRA
# Apply a valid license for both JIRA and JIRA Agile
# Create a board
# Expire JIRA license
# Attempt to create an epic through Agile's board
# Spinning wheel occurs

Nothing is logged in JIRA and the only error message we could find was through chrome's developer tools under the Network tab. A 400 Bad Request, followed by the license expired messaged appeared.

h4. Expected Behaviour

The application should show a message warning the customer that he can't create the issues because of his license, instead of displaying an endless spinning wheel.
fields.summary: Creating epic with expired JIRA license throws spinning wheel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to load the Application Navigator (!http://donatellibuilders.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/menu-burger.png! icon in the top menu bar)  from within the user's profile page (http://jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa), the menu options are not loaded and JIRA keeps showing a spinning loading icon instead.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.3.x
* HipChat Plugin 6.14.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a website to the *Application Navigator* (_Administration » System » User Interface / Application Navigator_)
# Access your profile page
# Try to use the Application Navigator to access the website added.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA would show the options (a link to itself and the website added)

h3. Actual Results
JIRA shows a spinning loading icon instead
 
h3. Notes
It was reported this may also cause other menu's not to load (e.g. Agile, Service Desk, Issues, Projects, etc.)

h3.Solution / Workaround
Disable all HipChat plugins:
# Access _Administration » Add-ons » Manage Add-ons_
# Find and Disable:
#* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin
#* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core
#* HipChat for JIRA
fields.summary: Application Navigator doesn't load in the Profile page

fields.description:
h3. Expected behavior
JIRA would confirm the deletion of a field value, verifying workflow post-functions for the use of that field value.

h3. Actual behavior
The field value to be defined will be replaced by a numeric value, possibly the field's ID on the database (see screenshot below).

!broken_fieldvalue_postfunction.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add a post-function on any transition of a workflow to have the "Resolution" or "Priority" field set to any value.
# Publish the workflow and have it set to "Active".
# Delete that value from "Resolutions" or "Priorities" under _Issues_ administration panel.

h3. Workaround
Modify any post-function using that value to another value.
fields.summary: Broken 'Update Field Value' post-function after removal of value
Allow Customizing Move Issue Screen

Users that are disabled are still having their "Last Session" recorded when attempting to access JIRA.

Steps to reproduce.

# Disable an user (Removing him from all groups)
# Try logging as the disabled user:
You will be able to authenticate on JIRA, but will have no access to perform any actions, due to lack of permissions.
# Last Session will be updated.
fields.summary: Disabled users update last session

fields.description:
After moving a parent issue of a subtask, user is unable to search the old issue key of these moved subtasks. When trying to search the old issue key, an error message will appear "

{quote}
The issue you are trying to view does not exist.
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
Return to Search
{quote}

!subtask.png|thumbnail!

New issue key can be search. 

Resolution 
This issue does not occur in newer JIRA versions. [Upgrade JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA] to 6.2 or later to resolve this.
[Cannot search old issue key of subtask when parent issue is moved to another project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Cannot+search+old+issue+key+of+subtask+when+parent+issue+is+moved+to+another+project]
fields.summary: Cannot search old issue key of subtask when parent issue is moved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42525].
  {panel}

In Google Chrome 41, on Mac OSX, JIRA has an unusual display issue when using a USB mouse: [Example of issue|https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/3e2Q3R2m3w112g2r0d27/Screen%20Recording%202015-03-19%20at%2011.21%20am.gif]

Steps to emulate:

* Visit a JIRA issue, with related tickets, in Google Chrome 41+ on Mac OSX (e.g. https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-9412)
* Plug in a USB Mouse

The behaviour will cease when the USB mouse is removed, and will recur again when it is re-inserted. I believe this is because Chrome (or OSX) detects a scroll mouse installed and adds the side scroll bar to the page.

I've tried reproducing this in the following ways:

* Other USB Mouse; consistently causes the issue
* Other Browsers; bug is not apparent in Safari or Firefox
fields.summary: USB Mouse causing UI display issue on Mac OSX using Chrome 41.x

When users add the latest version of the Drag and Drop plugin, the plugin section on the sidebar disappears.

- Affected version: 3.2.5(works fine in 3.1.13).
- JIRA Version tested: 6.3.15

The images from the documentation show they are expected to be there.

I have attached images of the current way it appears in my JIRA instance.

h5. Workaround:
Uninstall the plugin and download an older version(recommend 3.1.13)

|!Drag and Drop Marketspace image.PNG|thumbnail!|!Drag and Drop installed.PNG|thumbnail!|!Missing Drag and Drop.PNG|thumbnail!|

Thanks.
fields.summary: JIRA Drag and Drop Plugin Does not appear on the side bar

fields.description:
UPM 2.17.13 does not accept license for ctime - JIRA Time Tracking & Reporting.

The license is correct but it shows incompatible with product license ( wrong type ) 

!ic2.JPG|thumbnail!

When trying to log time, an error message shows that the license is not valid. 

!ic1.JPG|thumbnail!

Unable to log work, view logs or run any reports.


{panel}
*Workaround : *
Update UPM :
1. Go to Manage Add-ons page
2. Scroll to Atlassian Universal Plugin Manager Plugin
3. Click update
4. Restart JIRA & Re-index.
{panel}
fields.summary: ictime - JIRA Time Tracking & Reporting does not work with  UPM 2.17.13

After configuring an LDAP server with read/write configuration against a brand new empty JIRA v6.4, when an attempt is made to add the JIRA internal group "jira-users" to the LDAP based user, JIRA pops up a modal crash box with the exception below.

(This modal box has all scrolling disabled, and the box disappears off the bottom of the screen).

One of the following fixes is needed:

- If you can't add a JIRA internal group to an LDAP user, don't offer the UI for it; or
- Show some kind of useful message indicating what the admin must do. If the admin must create corresponding entries in the LDAP server for the JIRA groups, offer an easy way to allow the admin to do this.

Request assistance

Copy the content below and send it to your JIRA Administrator

Casual JIRA users (and newbies) find it confusing that some incompatible issue types are not visible in the edit and view screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42492].
  {panel}

When creating a JIRA instance from scratch, the following priorities are created by default:

||ID||Name||
|1|Highest|
|2|High|
|3|Medium|
|4|Low|
|5|Lowest|

If we create one issue with each priority and search for issues, they are correctly retrieved.

However, if we rename the priorities for numbers, and those numbers are the IDs of other priorities, JIRA will search for the IDs and not the priority names, bringing inconsistent results.

For instance, If we search for priority name "High",  it will bring issues with priority set to "High".
Let's say we edit the priority names to the following:

||ID||Name||
|1|Highest|
|2|3|
|3|2|
|4|Low|
|5|Lowest|

If we search for priority name "2" (which was the High priority in the first example),  it will bring issues with priority "ID" 2, not consistent with the expected results, since in the screen we select the priorities according to their names:
!Screen Shot 2015-03-17 at 8.07.42 PM.png!
fields.summary: Searching issues using the priority doesn't work properly

h4. Summary:
Creating issues through email in JIRA sometimes fail. Only error is 
{code}
An error was encountered whilst handling messages from the mail server
"POP Mail Server" using the handler "class com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.RegexCommentHandler".

The error was:
------------------------
"Could not find a corresponding issue to comment and 'Create a new issue from each email' is not selected."
------------------------

The error and the email that caused the error are attached to this email.

If this is a recurring problem, you may wish to contact a system administrator to check the parameters of your mail fetching service:
{code}

h4. Steps To Replicate:
Create 2 mail handlers
- The first should contain the following settings:
{code}
Create a new issue from each email message
POP Mail Server
mailstore
 Support	 Task	
Bulk: forward
CC Assignee: false
CC Watchers: false
Create Users: false
Default Reporter: <defaultreporter>
Forward Email: <email-address>
Notify Users: false
Strip Quotes: false
{code}

- The second should contain the following settings:
{code}
Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body
POP Mail Server
mailstore
Bulk: forward
CC Assignee: true
CC Watchers: false
Create Users: false
Default Reporter: <defaultreporter>
Forward Email: <email-address>
Notify Users: false
Split Regex: /From: |> |-- /
Strip Quotes: false
{code}

- Create an issue via email, sometimes it will fail and other times it will succeed
fields.summary: Inconsistent Behavior for Mail Handlers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42484].
  {panel}

We're using 2 configuration settings that come into conflict with each other:

1) we use the property "jira.permission.comment.user -> denied" on the workflow step "Closed"
2) we use the "Comment Required Validator" on the workflow transition "Close"

The post functions of the "Close" transition are as follows:
1) The Resolution of the issue will be set to Fixed.
2) Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step.
3) Assign the issue to the reporter.
4) Add a comment to an issue if one is entered during a transition.
5) Update change history for an issue and store the issue in the database.
6) Re-index an issue to keep indexes in sync with the database.
7) Fire a Issue Closed Customer Canceled event that can be processed by the listeners.

As you can see, the issue is closed (2) before the comment is added (4).
This results into an error message because of the property setting in the "Closed" step (jira.permission.comment.user denied).

Unfortunately, JIRA does not allow to change the sequence of these post functions.
fields.summary: Allow default Post Function to be re-ordered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42481].
  {panel}

When creating a new issue, if you press Escape (intentionally or otherwise) while you are writing the issue, a browser warning pops-up: "You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost." 

This is highly desirable, as it prevents accidental loss of work.

However, if you press Create but you have a validation error (in my case, I'd written a long description, but had forgotten to complete the Summary field), this appears to reset the warning dialog. I accidentally hit Escape at this point, and I didn't get any warning message - it threw away all of my work.

:(

*To reiterate:*
1. Start to create a new issue, put some text in the Description
2. Press Escape - you'll get warned about loss of work
3. Press Cancel, and keep writing your Description
4. Press Create - JIRA will respond with inline validation messages e.g. Summary is required
5. Press Escape - {color:red}BUG {color} there's no warning, it dismisses the dialog
fields.summary: Create Issue: Pressing Esc immediately closes dialog after validation failure

fields.description:
Taken from AAC:

I am running JIRA server 6.3.7 and trying to test out integration with HipChat.
Looking in the add-on manager, I see that I have version 1.3.4 of the HipChat for JIRA add-on installed. If I search for this add-on in the Marketplace, I see that a significantly newer version is available (6.14.0). However, there is no indication in the JIRA add-on manager that an update is available, even though my version of JIRA supports this version of the HipChat for JIRA add-on.
I'm wondering what the appropriate procedure is for obtaining the latest version. Do I just download the add-on and install in manually? Or is there something I need to do to get the add-on manager to recognize that an update is available?

This is what I meant by installing manually - I'm aware that I could use that method. My question was more along the lines of: is there a reason why the UPM is not recognizing that an update to the HipChat add-on is available?

Is it the intended procedure that I update manually? Or should the UPM see that an update is available?

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13411651/how-do-i-get-the-latest-version-of-the-hipchat-for-jira-add-on
fields.summary: Jira Server Add-On manager not updating with latest HipChat version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42447].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently with the User Picker field on a custom field, you can Configure the field to be restricted to a certain group. This does seem to be an overall change, so you won't be able to use the field in more than one project with different sets of users.

h4. Solution
Create permission schemes per project and allow to choose which scheme to use on each project.

h4. Example
Project A uses group Users A
Project B users group Users B

When selecting from that field, you only want to be able to select from Users A or B, depending on which project is using the custom field.

h4. Currently
Required that you create a new custom field for each project and specify the group there.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict groups to User Picker per Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42446].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently, the *Reporter* field can be changed from Current User to any browsable user in the system. If you start entering a user that does not have Create Issues permission on that project, it still shows them.

Assignee already works like this; if you try to type a user that is not assignable, they do not show up.

h4. Resolution
Only show users that can create issues in that project, as already exists for Assignee field.
fields.summary: Restrict Reporter Field to only users with Create Issues Permission
JIRA Mail Handler should handle repeated failure to process an email better

fields.description:
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e2450

This API says to use POST for larger JQL queries. When POST is used with the same parameters as GET, the comment field is not returned. Using GET the comment field is returned as expected. It doesn't make any difference how the field parameter is specified using *\*all* or explicitly requesting the *comment* field.
fields.summary: Search REST API using POST not returning comment field

fields.description: h3. Summary of bug In JIRA 6.4, there is a new field for Attachment (which uses drag & drop). However, it seems to be ignoring HTML tags inserted into the description of the field. h3. Steps to replicate # Use JIRA 6.4 (in this test, it was using the EAP version) # Add a description with HTML tags in the Attachment field #* In my test, it was this : {{this should be bold}} # Try creating an issue, and in the Create issue screen, take a look at the Attachment field : !HTML.png|thumbnail! h3. Additional notes * I also tried this with some other fields (like the Description and Labels fields), but those appear to utilize the HTML tags with no problem
fields.summary: Attachment field does not take into account HTML tags in JIRA 6.4
Attachments menu in JIRA 6.4 should show maximum size limit
UpgradeManager has a major liability in the way it instantiates classes
REST APIs for JIRA 6.2 and 6.3 were not published

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42436].
  {panel}
h3. Summary
When performing a bulk operation on issues, the count for the issues will be inflated by the number of sub tasks those issues have (even if the sub tasks aren't selected for the bulk operation).

This is a *display problem*, as the sub tasks themselves aren't changed (unless they were selected in the bulk operation).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue ({{TEST-1}}, and a sub task for that issue ({{TEST-2}}
# Find the issue with JQL ({{KEY = TEST-1}}) and bulk edit that one issue

h3. Expected Results
The message above the progress bar shows one issue is being edited.

h3. Actual Results
The message above the progress bar shows the number of issues being edited plus the count of subtasks those issues have (although only the issues selected are being edited).

*Bulk Operation:*
!bulk.png|thumbnail! 

*Message:*
!message.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Jira is incorrectly including the sub tasks as a part of the calculation.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Bulk Operations on Issues with Sub Tasks will show the wrong progress count
Make it possible to automatically update a field in a child issue whenever this field is updated in the parent.
REST API - Worklog Filter

fields.description:
We've run into some problems with the Attach Screenshot functionality, unfortunately. It appears IE 9 users are not able to use the "Attach Screenshot" functionality under the "More" dropdown. See below:

!attach_screenshot_031215_020228_PM.jpg|thumbnail!

On another user's computer, I got a similar error message, but says this instead:

{quote}
Your Java security settings are blocking this feature. Please upgrade to the latest Java.
{quote}

*Steps to Recreate*
# Open an issue using IE 9.
# Go to *More -> Attach Screenshot*
# Confirm that an error occurs and the app not available to use.

This issue was reported in JRA-36416 - it's true that this is resolved for IE 11 (we can confirm this works just fine in IE 11), but this functionality still doesn't work for IE 9. I have not been able to recreate this issue in any other browsers.

h3. Fix

This is a configuration issue in the IE9 browser's security settings. Please Update/Install the latest version of JAVA.
# Open IE9 and access JIRA. IE will ask if you want to Allow Java add-on -> Click Yes.
# Open an issue. From More -> Attach Screenshot -> IE will ask if you want to Allow Applet for JIRA -> Click Yes
If you still facing issue, please feel free to raise a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: In IE, a user should be able to use the "Attach Screenshot" functionality.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42431].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA has both a background and foreground reindex option. The second option causes JIRA to be locked until it's finished with no option to cancel it during the operation.

This foreground (lock JIRA and rebuild index) may cause an outage, even in production instances, which cannot be stopped once started. In large instances, it may take hours to finish.

There is currently no message warning the user of this behavior and due to a mistake or lack of knowledge, an administrator may lock a production instance without option to cancel. 

Also, outages may have a great cost to some users.

As a customer, a warn message clearly explaining that this is an operation that cannot be cancelled and will lock the instance until it is finished would prevent outages.
fields.summary: Add warning message for foreground re-index before locking JIRA Cloud
Highlight changes in email
Allow Collapsible Text Within A Comment

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42423].

Hello,
We accidentally deleted some important tickets and few users.
Is there a way to restore them?
Please let us know, we'd really appreciate it. 
Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42420].
  {panel}

Using Jira 6.3.6 I have not been able to import "Original Estimate" using for example attached files. The issue is created successfully (no errors in report either) but "Original Estimate" field in the finished user story in Jira is empty although I could see the value "21600" while performing the import steps. I have followed the guide in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Importing+Data+from+CSV
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer

"The value of this field needs to be specified as number of seconds." which I have specified it as 21600, which is 6h.
I can't import "Remaining Estimate" or "Time Spent" either, all other fields of interest for me is no problem to import.

h1.Workaround:
Use the CSV import option detailed here:
- [For JIRA Cloud | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Importing+Data+from+CSV#ImportingDatafromCSV-how]
- [For JIRA Server | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV#ImportingDatafromCSV-how]
fields.summary: Import CSV field "Original Estimate" does not import
Allow Internal users to login with SSO enabled

fields.description:
I am getting a stack trace inside a custom field value on the view issue page:

!approving manager.png!

{{AbstractFieldScreenLayoutItem.getViewHtml}} needs to log the exception and display a user-friendly error rather than explode in the user's face.

The issue about fixing the underlying cause is JRA-42414. This issue is about making JIRA resilient to misbehaving plugins.
fields.summary: JIRA shows massive stack trace if there's an exception during custom field rendering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42412].
  {panel}

This should be fixed on 7.0.
Apparently these have changed, which is fine. However, I couldn't find mention of the new links in JIRA's code base, so we should update to them.

This story involves three things:
* talking with Purchasing to determine what these URLs should be (see https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-support-tools-plugin/pull-request/77/stp-342-corrected-stp-license-renewal-link/diff )
* changing existing URLs to be https instead of http (we should be able to check that they are OK)
* verifying that the new URLs actually work :)
fields.summary: License banner links are incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42411].
  {panel}

Anonymous users CAN access JIRA Agile Releases section correctly but get a 500 error when accessing a specific version with the following error:

{noformat}
Cause
Referer URL: Unknown
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In template JIRA.Projects.Templates.page: In 'print' tag, expression "$sidebarContent" evaluates to undefined.
com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In template JIRA.Projects.Templates.page: In 'print' tag, expression "$sidebarContent" evaluates to undefined.
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMainHelper(BaseTofu.java:341)
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.renderMain(BaseTofu.java:300)
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu.access$100(BaseTofu.java:56)
	at com.google.template.soy.tofu.internal.BaseTofu$RendererImpl.render(BaseTofu.java:427)
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyManager.render(DefaultSoyManager.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.render(DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.render(DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraSoyViewDispatcher.dispatch(JiraSoyViewDispatcher.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchViaSoyView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:204)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
....
{noformat}

Logged in users can view the section correctly.

*Scenario:*
Project Permissions configuration allows Group(Anyone) to "Browse Projects" and "View Development Tools" so it should grant public access to the Releases new section and the Versions.

*Cause:*
The new sidebar panel requires user.name() to be constructed and hits a NullPointerException when the user is anonymous.

A fix is already in the works and will be released soon.
fields.summary: Browsing Versions in anonymous mode hits a 500 error
Base URL not used in project avatar upload dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42409].
  {panel}

When updating the contents of any JIRA description, including the unicode character [http://unicodelookup.com/#0x1D11E/1] causes it to silently discard the changes.

There's 2 issues here:
 # It's a silent discard. A lot of work can be lost with no feedback and no chance to recover the discarded text.
 # We can't have cases with this character in there.

 

(!) NOTE: This issue no longer reproduces in JIRA Server 7.2.0 𝄞
fields.summary: A JIRA issue description is silently discarded if it contains a specific unicode character
Add priority arrow emoticons

fields.description:
When attaching an archive file that has been created using a libarchive based application, and attach it to a JIRA Issue, the following error occurs in the Attachments module:

Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:attachmentmodule'. Please contact your JIRA administrators.

The error occurs anytime the file is added to the issue (either during creation or view).

Workaround:
Rearchive the file using another utility, or click the down arrow in the attachments area and go to "Manage Attachments". The file can be accessed successfully from this area.
fields.summary: Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:attachment module' when attaching libarchive zip files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we import CSV data into JIRA via System External Import, fields with duplicate names will be somehow mapped to Custom field rather than the System field even if I choose the correct field during the import.

I suspect there is a bug in the CSV Importer around the name of a custom field when selecting it for import, particularly if there is a standard field by the same name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field named "Status". Not a good idea, but that's what was done.
# Create a CSV file for import with Issue ID, reporter, summary, status columns.
# Use the CSV importer to import the CSV file, mapping as expected. Select the standard JIRA field Status for the status column.
# Note that the custom field named Status is selected since it is named as a custom field, not a standard field in the CSV Importer mapping.

h3. Expected Results
The System field Status should have been updated.

h3. Actual Results
The Custom field Status have been updated.

h3.Workaround
*Option 1*
# After mapping the fields for the import, the import wizard will give you the option to _Begin import_. 
# At this page, click Back button on your web browser.
# Choose again the standard Status field again.

*Option 2*
# Rename the Custom Field to a different name before the import.
# Perform the CSV import.
# Rename back the Custom field back to the original name.
fields.summary: CSV Importer gets fields confused

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42405].
  {panel}

When importing a sub-task via CSV, you should require a reference to the parent issue.
If you try to import the CSV via _Issues > Import Issues from CSV_, that validation is done, however when importing through _Administration > System > External System Import_ the CSV import creates orphan sub-tasks.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a CSV with only a sub-task to be created, with no parent issue specified
# Import CSV using External System Import

*Expected Behaviour*
A warning message saying "Subtask 'Issue' doesn't have a valid Parent Id selection. Issue will not be created." should be displayed (as it is on "Import Issues from CSV")

*Actual behaviour*
Issue is created successfully without a parent
fields.summary: CSV import allow orphan sub-task via External System Import

*Background of the request*
Currently, Jira does not have the function to update all the plugin in "one go" instead user need to update the plugin one by one.

*Example*
User have 10 plugin need to be updated. It will be easier if there is an option to click update all then all the plugin will be updated.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42396].
  {panel}

Actual Situation:
The URL to the attachment is e.g.
https://ourcompany/secure/attachment/10409/Description_of_Suggestion.docx
"https://ourcompany/secure/attachment": Comes from the General Settings.
10409: created by Jira
Description_of_Suggestion.docx: File-Name of the Attachement

If I attach the same Document to another issue of the same Project, the URL to the attachment is this:
https://ourcompany/secure/attachment/10410/Description_of_Suggestion.docx
If I attach the same Document to an issue of another Project, the URL to the attachment is this:
https://ourcompany/secure/attachment/10411/Description_of_Suggestion.docx
Only the "Counter" changes. I cannnot see, that the attachment belongs to another Project.

Suggestion: 
Make the Project-Key visible in the URL of the Attachments.
fields.summary: Project specific Path and URL to Attachments
